data.response:
You're trying to inject some XSS (Cross-Site Scripting) code.

The `&#x27;` and `'` notation is used to represent an apostrophe in HTML entities. However, this particular code snippet won't execute any malicious script on your browser because it's not a complete JavaScript expression.

To inject XSS code and execute it, you'd need a more complex setup, such as:

```
<!-- This would create a JavaScript alert box that says 'XSS' -->
<script>alert('XSS');</script>

<!-- Or this would allow user input to inject malicious scripts -->
<form><input type="text"><script>document.write('<%= request.body %>)</script></form>
```

Keep in mind that XSS vulnerabilities are typically exploited through more sophisticated attacks, such as storing or transmitting sensitive data without proper sanitization.
